publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2086 Fiona McLeod: e-mission 55 -- Business for Climate—That the Parliament welcomes the recently established "e-mission 55 – Business for Climate" initiative; commends the 90-plus companies who have grouped together under this collective to call on governments around the world to finalise the Kyoto Protocol; congratulates them for exceeding their original target of 55, and urges Scottish businesses to sign up to this initiative.
S1M-2086 e-mission 55 - Business for Climate (lodged on 25 July 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Shona Robison*, Christine Grahame*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2086 e-mission 55 - Business for Climate (lodged on 25 July 2001) Colin Campbell*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-2086 Fiona McLeod: e-mission 55-Business for Climate—That the Parliament welcomes the recently established "e-mission 55 – Business for Climate" initiative; commends the 90-plus companies who have grouped together under this collective to call on governments around the world to finalise the Kyoto Protocol; congratulates them for exceeding their original target of 55, and urges Scottish businesses to sign up to this initiative. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-2086 e-mission 55-Business for Climate (lodged on 25 July 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-2086 Fiona McLeod: e-mission 55-Business for Climate-That the Parliament welcomes the recently established "e-mission 55 - Business for Climate" initiative; commends the 90-plus companies who have grouped together under this collective to call on governments around the world to finalise the Kyoto Protocol; congratulates them for exceeding their original target of 55, and urges Scottish businesses to sign up to this initiative. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-2086 e-mission 55-Business for Climate (lodged on 25 July 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-2086 Fiona McLeod: e-mission 55-Business for Climate—That the Parliament welcomes the recently established "e-mission 55 – Business for Climate" initiative; commends the 90-plus companies who have grouped together under this collective to call on governments around the world to finalise the Kyoto Protocol; congratulates them for exceeding their original target of 55, and urges Scottish businesses to sign up to this initiative. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Kenneth Gibson

S1M-2086 Fiona McLeod: e-mission 55-Business for Climate-That the Parliament welcomes the recently established "e-mission 55 - Business for Climate" initiative; commends the 90-plus companies who have grouped together under this collective to call on governments around the world to finalise the Kyoto Protocol; congratulates them for exceeding their original target of 55, and urges Scottish businesses to sign up to this initiative. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Kenneth Gibson
S1M-2086 e-mission 55-Business for Climate (lodged on 25 July 2001) Roseanna Cunningham*

S1M-2086 Fiona McLeod: e-mission 55-Business for Climate-That the Parliament welcomes the recently established "e-mission 55 - Business for Climate" initiative; commends the 90-plus companies who have grouped together under this collective to call on governments around the world to finalise the Kyoto Protocol; congratulates them for exceeding their original target of 55, and urges Scottish businesses to sign up to this initiative. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Roseanna Cunningham
